Package com.midiwars.logic

Class Player

  • Object
    • Player

  • public class Player
extends Object
    A music player for midi files. (Singleton)

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Class Description
      static class  Player.State
      The current state of the player.

      The previous contents of the clipboard prior to playing.

      Note (index) to resume playback from.

      Amount of time (ms) to sleep when moving to next or previous song.

    • Method Detail

      • getInstance

        public static Player getInstance​()
        Getter.
        Returns:
        The instance.

      • getState

        public Player.State getState​()
        Getter.
        Returns:
        The current state of the app.

      • resume

        public void resume​()
            throws AWTException,
                   InterruptedException,
                   InvalidMidiDataException,
                   IOException
        Resumes playback.
        Throws:
        AWTException - If the platform configuration does not allow low-level input control.
        InterruptedException - If a thread was interrupted.
        InvalidMidiDataException - If midi file is invalid.
        IOException - If can't open file.

      • play

        public void play​(String[] playlist,
                 boolean shuffle,
                 boolean repeat,
                 Instrument instrument)
          throws AWTException,
                 InterruptedException,
                 InvalidMidiDataException,
                 IOException
        Starts playback.
        Parameters:
        playlist - Playlist to play.
        shuffle - True if player should switch to shuffle mode.
        repeat - True if playlist should repeat upon ending.
        instrument - Instrument to play given playlist with.
        Throws:
        AWTException - If the platform configuration does not allow low-level input control.
        InterruptedException - If a thread was interrupted.
        InvalidMidiDataException - If midi file is invalid.
        IOException - If can't open file.

      • stop

        public void stop​()
          throws InterruptedException
        Stops playback.
        Throws:
        InterruptedException - If a thread was interrupted.

      • pause

        public void pause​()
           throws InterruptedException
        Pauses playback.
        Throws:
        InterruptedException - If a thread was interrupted.

      • shuffle

        private void shuffle​(boolean repeat)
        Shuffles the playlist, following the Fisher–Yates shuffle algorithm. Also sets currentSong to 0.
        Parameters:
        repeat - True if the previous song should be the first song in the playlist, False if it should NOT be the first song in the playlist.

      • nextOrPrev

        private void nextOrPrev​(boolean next)
                 throws AWTException,
                        InterruptedException,
                        InvalidMidiDataException,
                        IOException
        Plays either the next or the previous midi file.
        Parameters:
        next - True to play next midi file, False to play previous midi file.
        Throws:
        AWTException - If the platform configuration does not allow low-level input control.
        InterruptedException - If a thread was interrupted.
        InvalidMidiDataException - If midi file is invalid.
        IOException - If can't open file.

      • next

        public void next​()
          throws AWTException,
                 InterruptedException,
                 InvalidMidiDataException,
                 IOException
        Plays the next song.
        Throws:
        AWTException - If the platform configuration does not allow low-level input control.
        InterruptedException - If a thread was interrupted.
        InvalidMidiDataException - If midi file is invalid.
        IOException - If can't open file.

      • prev

        public void prev​()
          throws AWTException,
                 InterruptedException,
                 InvalidMidiDataException,
                 IOException
        Plays previous song.
        Throws:
        AWTException - If the platform configuration does not allow low-level input control.
        InterruptedException - If a thread was interrupted.
        InvalidMidiDataException - If midi file is invalid.
        IOException - If can't open file.
